Posted By: Nucleon (1/27/2012 10:46:42 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I love how the white is blowing people's minds. Sorin is all about order and long-range planning, the epitome of white. He created Avacyn to maintain balance so that the human population that he and the other vampires depend on wouldn't be overfished to extinction by the gangs of monsters roaming Innistrad. Not to mention the whole "sealing the Eldrazi away so that the multiverse doesn't, you know, end" thing.   
  
Sorin will totally yoink your blood and eat his cereal out of your skull when he's finished (black), but he also has the foresight to realize that there needs to be rules and balance to ensure that everything keeps on going, since society disappearing means his kind disappearing (white). It's not really that hard to wrap your mind around, folks.
posts.html:
I love how the white is blowing people's minds. Sorin is all about order and long-range planning, the epitome of white. He created Avacyn to maintain balance so that the human population that he and the other vampires depend on wouldn't be overfished to extinction by the gangs of monsters roaming Innistrad. Not to mention the whole "sealing the Eldrazi away so that the multiverse doesn't, you know, end" thing.

Sorin will totally yoink your blood and eat his cereal out of your skull when he's finished (black), but he also has the foresight to realize that there needs to be rules and balance to ensure that everything keeps on going, since society disappearing means his kind disappearing (white). It's not really that hard to wrap your mind around, folks.

Posted By: Enemy_Tricolor (3/17/2012 10:48:49 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @ Thana. You didn't actually give him .5 stars for his type did you? Let me explain this to you. Black= death, not evil. There is no reason for werewolves to be black. They are red and green depending on whether they want to depict their nature at wild animals or furious killers. Vampires come in red to show their recklessness. And most importantly, Sorin has white because he is no average vampire. It's indicative of his oath to help mankind so that they have a fighting chance against the horrors of Innistrad. As for the card himself, if you make good use of an emblem, it's a huge deal. He comes in handy with token gen too. BW tokens are big because of him, and once ratchet bomb and corrosive gale cycle out, they'll explode. I love this card.
posts.html:

Posted By: Dr.Pingas (1/27/2012 5:46:06 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I'm sorry, but his token generating ability is much, much worse than [Bloodline Keeper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodline Keeper)'s. It's good to have lifelink, but this ability is only good with [Stromkirk Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stromkirk Captain) or [Lord of Lineage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of Lineage). Maybe even a [Nocturnus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nocturnus). His -2, however, is awesome. ESPECIALLY with [Stromkirk Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stromkirk Captain). His -6 is interesting, but it's no [Liliana Vess](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana Vess). All in all, I prefer his other form, but that also has its drawbacks. All in all, he's an overcosted planeswalker. I do like the cheap playing cost, and for a {4} cmc, i actually think that he is a lot better than [Ajani Goldmane](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani Goldmane). All in all, I'd give him 4/5, because quite honestly A) he's cheap for ok/good abilities, and B) I'm afraid he'd track me down and kill me with his massive-@$$ sword if I gave him 3/5.
posts.html:

EDIT EDIT EDIT: This combo does work- it's horribly complicated, not practical for a normal game, but it works. Blame the Simic guild, because Experiment Kraj really can do this. Sorin is vital, because without his ability to REANIMATE Planeswalkers, you WOULD be limited by a '1 per turn' activation issue. There is a very, very, very good reason that Sorin's wording says 'other' planeswalkers. Wizards knows that if Sorin ever got targeted by his own Ultimate, all hell breaks loose. It's to try to stop Mad Johnnies from pulling this kind of bullcrap. My previous attempt to use Tezzeret 1 to untap Kraj to give Sorin a +1/... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
I really like the flavor of this card... "Lord of Innistrad"  
And he is. He built an angel to form a church... which now controls the hearts and minds of the people of innistrad... Why? Well that's a good question.  
  
Either A: he's slightly benevolent and doesn't want humans to be extinct... (Fairly unlikely)  
Or B: he cares for vampires and needed someone to farm humans so that his own kind didn't starve.  
Or C: Humans going extinct would have ruined the plain in general, and he doesn't like ugly messes like that.  
  
In any case, he's clearly the man in charge (and no one knows it which makes him cooler) His ambiguous motives make him all the more interesting...
posts.html:
I really like the flavor of this card... "Lord of Innistrad"
And he is. He built an angel to form a church... which now controls the hearts and minds of the people of innistrad... Why? Well that's a good question.

Either A: he's slightly benevolent and doesn't want humans to be extinct... (Fairly unlikely)
Or B: he cares for vampires and needed someone to farm humans so that his own kind didn't starve.
Or C: Humans going extinct would have ruined the plain in general, and he doesn't like ugly messes like that.

In any case, he's clearly the man in charge (and no one knows it which makes him cooler) His ambiguous motives make him all the more interesting...

Posted By: MyrBattlecube (3/27/2012 12:01:05 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
"Mankind ill needs a savior such as you!"  
  
  
For some reason, the J apanese version of this card has vastly superior art... ;-)  
  
More seriously, it's a shame they decided to cut off one of the coolest parts of this artwork-  
the frame is blocking the white magic he's conjuring at his fingertip.  
It looks really nice with the black wisps surrounding it, and it's part of his flavor now, as well.  
  
As for the card, well... he rocks. The colors aren't for everyone, but he's a very solid pick.  
As an Esper player, I've been wanting a good {W/B} PW for ages,  
and Sorin does not disappoint!
posts.html:
"Mankind ill needs a savior such as you!"


For some reason, the J apanese version of this card has vastly superior art... ;-)

It looks really nice with the black wisps surrounding it, and it's part of his flavor now, as well.

As for the card, well... he rocks. The colors aren't for everyone, but he's a very solid pick.
As an Esper player, I've been wanting a good {W/B} PW for ages,
and Sorin does not disappoint!
